The " 10,000 hours rule " ( never a rule , decried by a thousand cognitive scientists , plucked from research to be cast into podcast-perpetual-pandering by Gladwell , Like He Does ) in original context actually talks about deliberate practice and * rest * cycles .

Creativity research reliably documents the importance of deep rest , and that the people privileged to be able to live highly creative lives often have these deep rest cycles built in . Has been missed in research often but profoundly predictive of work outcomes when included .

Rest is required for learning ( & forgetting is required for learning ! ) . Learning isn't just mashing more content into a bucket-brain forever . Lots of effects ( from deliberate practice to spacing ) show cram / work ' til you drop methods are inefficient , destructive in the longterm .
